title: Full screen broken? Resolution issue?
body:
So recently windows 10 released an update (the anniversary update) that has thrown me into quit a strange situation. After the update I started having resolution issues with league of legends. I used to play at 1768x992 (I believe... Its something like that and the only resolution like it) in full screen mode. After installing the update for win10 I had tried playing a game a league of legends and sure enough theres issues. My 'full screened window' was now a small box within the middle of the screen. It still worked like fullscreen does. It bound the mouse within the mini screen and had no edges. The resolution was set to '1024x668' or whatever the minimum resolution is. After rescaling it to my standard 1768x992 my issue went from being a little change in options to something much larger.

At this point when at 1768x992 my cursor location was askew. Where I click, the game clicks roughly a quarter of my screen to the right. When going through the options menu to try and adjust resolutions I would have to click way off to the left to actually hit a button. Not only this but for some reason my username and level are roughly the same distance off to the left of my healthbar where they should be affixed to. I have tried several things to resolve this issue such as changing resolutions (i've tried every option to no avail.) I have made sure my graphic card was up to date (Geforce GTX 560) it had an update that seemed unrelated to the windows update but I had ran the update anyway. After this had no positive effect I had also reverted back to the previous update of windows (where everything was working fine) but it didn't seen to fix anything still. 

If anyone has any clue what to do to resolve this I would be so appreciative. Atm I have been struggling to play at a smaller resolution in a windowed version but it sucks to play with a large chunk of my background still on the screen.

replies.body: I actually just fixed it. It has to do with the Xbox game bar. You have to open up the app, go to the settings, turn the DVR settings off for your PC. everything will run fine then.

Worked for me after playing for about a month with a miniature screen. Here is the youtube clip going more in depth for it.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sU6DFUgBE4g
This worked for me as well.
This worked, thank you so much

i thought this was just a weird solution since if you didnt have an xbox acc you literally had to make one to disable the DVR setting just to fix it. It sounded too retarded to be true but it really worked. Thank you so much!
Guys i did all this things but it still doesn't work...i cant play on full screen..

I did all these things but i still got that problem :/ anyone still got this problem? Or anyone else knows any other solution for this problem?
Thanks in advance.

In general, just a heads up that 4k monitors are not currently supported if this is the case for you.  I appreciate that you've already taken some steps to get this fixed up like making sure your drivers are updated.  At this point, hit us up in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so our tech team can look into this for you.  We'll respond to it asap!
I am having the same issue right now. please PM me if you have any answers, I haven't heard anything yet.
